newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Former Bangladesh minister quits opposition.
newsitem.headline: Former Bangladesh minister quits opposition.

text.p: A former minister and close confidant of ex-prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia has resigned from the opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), party sources said on Friday.

Retired Major-General Majedul Huq, former minister of agriculture, irrigation and water resources, handed two letters of resignation on Thursday to Khaleda Zia and BNP's secretary-general, Abdul Mannan Bhuiyan, the sources said.
"I am quitting for my own reasons. I will continue to work for the BNP," the Sangbad newspaper quoted him on Friday as saying.

The June election returned Awami League to power 21 years after it was ousted in a 1975 military coup that killed Bangladesh's independence leader, Sheikh Mjibur Rahman, along with most of his family.
Mujib's daughter and political heir, Sheikh Hasina, took over as prime minister on June 23.
